result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Prado Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel Prado Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Paul Kuszel for Julius Andriusis in court for Daniel Prado Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Katie Bakunowicz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Case scheduled for final pretrial. Defense waives Interpreter for today's proceedings only. Discussions regarding pending case and possible resolution. Case adjourned for another final pretrial, Branch 29.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 096138,
Payable Number: 1037675,
Receipt Number: 22RP040530,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Daniel Prado Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Avery L Goodrich Jr. appeared by video for Daniel Prado Jr.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Daniel Prado Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Avery L Goodrich Jr. in court for Daniel Prado Jr.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Avery L Goodrich in court, defendant Daniel Prado not in court, in custody.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials, but are still awaiting an offer from the state. Court adjourns matter for an additional Scheduling Conference date to Br 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Daniel Prado in court with Attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Daniel Prado in custody.  Abby Rockendorff appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Court took judicial notice of 21CF560. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officers C. Ulatowski & W. Williamson.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 29.
Defendant Daniel Prado not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for  a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with ELO
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring;   24 hour/7 days a week curfew with the exception of verified employment, medical and legal appointments..  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $25,000.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Defendant to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Daniel Prado in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Defendant Daniel Prado in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Daniel Prado appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2, 3 and 5.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE for Branch 29.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
